status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Sprinkler tank was installed in 2004 now making it 18 years old. 
The life of the lining has now become old and starting to fail.
scope_of_work.scope:
To supply labour and materials necessary to undertake the following works: 
Attend site prior to tank refurb to drain the tank & isolate the fire pump so work can commence
Return visit required to re-instate the pumps & put the system back online 
To pump to site drain within 10m of the tank the residual dead water off the tank floor. 
Removal of existing lining membrane. 
Clean and treat the external corrosion areas below the gauge and overflow connections. 
Provision of a skip to remove waste materials from site. 
Supply and Installation of; 
Geotextile protective matting liner underlay. 
Butyl rubber liner and associated fittings *(See guarantee details). 
New galvanised steel zed-purlins. 
Direct acting contents gauge connection. 
3kw Immersion heater. 
250mm dia. Internal suction pipework c/w vortex inhibitor. 
100mm dia. Internal overflow pipework. 
50mm dia. Cast iron equilibrium ball float valve. 
80mm dia. drain valve connection c/w lagging box. 
600mm dia. galvanised steel low level access manway. 
Vermin proof mesh to the overflow and tell-tale overflow connections.
scope_of_work.justification: The tank is now leaking as it seems that the tank liner is starting to fail could rupture at any time. This would end up leaving the site without sprinkler system cover in the event of a fire.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: This work is recommended to ensure continued fire protection system reliability and/or compliance.

project_name: UPM-DC Grey Space Corridor Flooring Repairs
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):rejected by Marge Hills (3):offer submitted by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The flooring in the grey space DC corridor is in a poor state of repair. Vinyl tiles are damaged or lifting, damage has been created causing potholes.
scope_of_work.scope: Repair and replace vinyl tiles as required, an estimated 75m2 has been anticipated.
scope_of_work.justification: The damaged flooring is a tripping hazard for all personnel using this corridor and also causes difficulties when moving materials around the space.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: There is serious likelihood that somebody will trip and injure themselves.

associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (No), O&M Manuals (No), Job Punch List (Yes), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (No), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)

closeout_billing: No project closeout and billing information

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Lola Wuckert (2):rejected by Marge Hills (3):offer submitted by Lola Wuckert

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The existing single steel door leading out to DRUPS 1 and 2 from the DC grey space corridor is in a very poor state of repair.  The doors are 20+ years old and form part of both the emergency exit route and security perimeter.  The door needs replacement.
scope_of_work.scope:
- Set up alternative escape route and barrier off the work area, 
- temporary removal of access control equipment,
- removal of the existing door and disposal off-site,
- replacement/installation of a new door and reinstatement of the the access control
- commissioning of the security controls.

Allowances have been made for making good the area around the door opening and also for the attendance of a security guard who will remain in post during the door replacement.
scope_of_work.justification: This door forms part of the emergency escape route and also controls access into critical plant areas.  The door has a very poor appearance and will be viewed negatively by Kyndryl customers visiting the site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The doors will continue to corrode and become difficult to open, causing health and safety issues.

scope_of_work.problem: Plant room and corridor walls have been damaged with the movement of equipment to/from the loading bay area
scope_of_work.scope: Repair/reinstate wall surfaces to various areas on the ground and first floor.
scope_of_work.justification: These areas are customer facing and do not create a good image for visitors
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Area will continue to appear in a poor condition.
